DataElement.preferredName: Surgical Procedure Tumor Tissue Surgical Clamp Indicator
DataElement.preferredDefinition: A yes/no response to indicate whether or not surgical clamps (clips, ties, or other method of cessation of blood flow) were used during the collection of surgical tumor tissue.

DataElementConcept.preferredName: Surgical Procedure Tumor Tissue Surgical Clamp
DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: A diagnostic or treatment procedure performed by manual and/or instrumental means, often involving an incision and the removal or replacement of a diseased organ or tissue; of or relating to or involving or used in surgery or requiring or amenable to treatment by surgery._A tumor sample, or entire tumor that is removed for microscopic examination._A surgical device used for compressing or holding an anatomic structure or other object.

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: A diagnostic or treatment procedure performed by manual and/or instrumental means, often involving an incision and the removal or replacement of a diseased organ or tissue; of or relating to or involving or used in surgery or requiring or amenable to treatment by surgery.:A tumor sample, or entire tumor that is removed for microscopic examination.

Concepts.definition: A diagnostic or treatment procedure performed by manual and/or instrumental means, often involving an incision and the removal or replacement of a diseased organ or tissue; of or relating to or involving or used in surgery or requiring or amenable to treatment by surgery.

Tissue sample that contains an abnormal cellular infiltrate forming a solid mass. The abnormal cellular component can be benign or malignant. Tumor samples are obtained for microscopic examination and/or molecular analysis.

Property.preferredDefinition: A surgical device used for compressing or holding an anatomic structure or other object.

Concepts.definition: A surgical device used for compressing or holding an anatomic structure or other object.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: Any specific activity undertaken during the course of a clinical study or research protocol.

DataElementConcept.changeDescription: 1/26/21 jk Released per SME (NGM) review and approval. 9/29/20 jk created CPTAC Solid tumor procurement CRF.

ValueDomain.preferredDefinition: The preferred Value Domain to indicate a question with permissible values of yes/no.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: Conceptual domain that includes value meanings to be used for Indicator Value Meanings such as Yes, No, Unknown, No Applicable

Concepts.definition: A response or indicator that can have a value of either yes or no.
